thread.title_full: Don't miss out on any of our exclusive football, basketball

author: rivals.com
title: Don't miss out on any of our exclusive football, basketball
text:
Don't miss out on any of our exclusive football, basketball and recruiting coverage. Click here to get your 30-day free trial!
Steve Dykes / USA Today Former IU All-American guard Yogi Ferrell has found an NBA home.
According to a report from The Vertical 's Shams Charania, Ferrell has agreed to a two-year deal with the Dallas Mavericks. The contract will be signed Tuesday after Ferrell's first 10-day contract expires, Charania reports.
Dallas' Yogi Ferrell has agreed on a two-year deal that he'll sign Tuesday when first 10-day expires, league sources tell The Vertical.
— Shams Charania (@ShamsCharania) February 4, 2017 According to The Vertical front office insider Bobby Marks, the prorated minimum on Ferrell's contract would be $208,000 starting Tuesday.
Prorated minimum for Yogi Ferrell would be $208k (signed on Tuesday). The second year (2017-18) would be $1.3m.
— Bobby Marks (@BobbyMarks42) February 4, 2017 Ferrell has started in each of the four games he's played in for the Mavericks, who originally signed the Indianapolis native to shore up depth at their point guard position which had been depleted by injuries to starter Deron Williams , backup J.J. Barea , and the previous replacement Pierre Jackson.
The two-year comes after Ferrell poured in a career-high 32 points, including nine 3-pointers, in the Mavericks' 108-104 win over the Portland Trail Blazers Friday night. The nine 3-pointers made tied Dallas' franchise rookie record for most 3-pointers made in a single game.
Since signing a 10-day contract with Dallas on Jan. 28, Ferrell has tallied 71 points, 20 assists and seven steals for the franchise in four games, good for an average of 17.8 points, five assists and 1.8 steals per game.
